The **2009 NBA draft** was held on June 25, 2009, at the [WaMu
Theatre](/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden#Other_venues "Madison Square Garden") at
[Madison Square Garden](/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden "Madison Square Garden")
in New York City. In this [draft](/wiki/Draft_\(sports\) "Draft \(sports\)"),
the [National Basketball Association](/wiki/National_Basketball_Association
"National Basketball Association") (NBA) teams took turns selecting amateur
U.S. [college basketball](/wiki/College_basketball "College basketball")
players and other eligible players, including international players.

The [Los Angeles Clippers](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Clippers "Los Angeles Clippers"),
who won the [draft lottery](/wiki/NBA_draft_lottery "NBA draft lottery") on
May 19, 2009, used their [first overall draft
pick](/wiki/List_of_first_overall_NBA_draft_picks "List of first overall NBA
draft picks") to draft [Blake Griffin](/wiki/Blake_Griffin "Blake Griffin")
from [University of Oklahoma](/wiki/University_of_Oklahoma "University of
Oklahoma").[1][2] However, he missed the entire [2009–10
season](/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_NBA_season "2009–10 NBA season") due to surgery
on his broken left kneecap, which he injured during the pre-season.[3]
[Tanzanian](/wiki/Tanzania "Tanzania")-born [Hasheem
Thabeet](/wiki/Hasheem_Thabeet "Hasheem Thabeet") from [University of
Connecticut](/wiki/University_of_Connecticut "University of Connecticut") was
drafted second by the [Memphis Grizzlies](/wiki/Memphis_Grizzlies "Memphis
Grizzlies"). Thabeet became the first player born in Tanzania to be drafted by
an NBA team.[4] [James Harden](/wiki/James_Harden "James Harden") was drafted
3rd by the [Oklahoma City Thunder](/wiki/Oklahoma_City_Thunder "Oklahoma City
Thunder"). This made him the first player to be drafted by the franchise as
the Oklahoma City Thunder whose franchise moved from Seattle to OKC in 2008.
The [Sacramento Kings](/wiki/Sacramento_Kings "Sacramento Kings") drafted
[Tyreke Evans](/wiki/Tyreke_Evans "Tyreke Evans") 4th; he was named 2009–10
[NBA Rookie of the Year](/wiki/NBA_Rookie_of_the_Year_Award "NBA Rookie of the
Year Award"), after he became the fourth NBA player in history to average at
least 20 points, 5 rebounds and 5 assists in his rookie season, joining the
elite club of [Oscar Robertson](/wiki/Oscar_Robertson "Oscar Robertson")
(1960), [Michael Jordan](/wiki/Michael_Jordan "Michael Jordan") (1984) and
[LeBron James](/wiki/LeBron_James "LeBron James") (2003). Spanish teenager
[Ricky Rubio](/wiki/Ricky_Rubio "Ricky Rubio") was drafted 5th by the
[Minnesota Timberwolves](/wiki/Minnesota_Timberwolves "Minnesota
Timberwolves"). Rubio became the fifth-highest-drafted international player
who never played U.S. college basketball to be drafted in the NBA, tied with
[Nikoloz Tskitishvili](/wiki/Nikoloz_Tskitishvili "Nikoloz Tskitishvili") (5th
in [2002](/wiki/2002_NBA_draft "2002 NBA draft")), and behind [Yao
Ming](/wiki/Yao_Ming "Yao Ming") (1st in 2002), [Andrea
Bargnani](/wiki/Andrea_Bargnani "Andrea Bargnani") (1st in
[2006](/wiki/2006_NBA_draft "2006 NBA draft")), [Darko
Miličić](/wiki/Darko_Mili%C4%8Di%C4%87 "Darko Miličić") (2nd in
[2003](/wiki/2003_NBA_draft "2003 NBA draft")) and [Pau Gasol](/wiki/Pau_Gasol
"Pau Gasol") (3rd in [2001](/wiki/2001_NBA_draft "2001 NBA draft")).[5]
Twenty-third pick [Omri Casspi](/wiki/Omri_Casspi "Omri Casspi") became the
first [Israeli](/wiki/Israel "Israel") player to be drafted in the first
round, and later he became the first Israeli to play in the NBA.[6]

The 2009 draft marked the first time three sons of former [NBA
players](/wiki/List_of_National_Basketball_Association_players "List of
National Basketball Association players") were selected in the top 15 picks of
the draft. [Stephen Curry](/wiki/Stephen_Curry "Stephen Curry"), son of [Dell
Curry](/wiki/Dell_Curry "Dell Curry"), was drafted 7th by the [Golden State
Warriors](/wiki/Golden_State_Warriors "Golden State Warriors"). [Gerald
Henderson Jr.](/wiki/Gerald_Henderson_Jr. "Gerald Henderson Jr."), son of
[Gerald Henderson](/wiki/Gerald_Henderson "Gerald Henderson"), was drafted
12th by the [Charlotte Bobcats](/wiki/Charlotte_Bobcats "Charlotte Bobcats").
[Austin Daye](/wiki/Austin_Daye "Austin Daye"), son of [Darren
Daye](/wiki/Darren_Daye "Darren Daye"), was drafted 15th by the [Detroit
Pistons](/wiki/Detroit_Pistons "Detroit Pistons").[5] The draft also marked
the first time a former high school player who skipped college to play
professional basketball in Europe was selected in an NBA draft. [Brandon
Jennings](/wiki/Brandon_Jennings "Brandon Jennings"), who skipped college to
play professional basketball with [Italian](/wiki/Lega_Basket_Serie_A "Lega
Basket Serie A") team [Lottomatica Roma](/wiki/Pallacanestro_Virtus_Roma
"Pallacanestro Virtus Roma"), was drafted 10th overall by the [Milwaukee
Bucks](/wiki/Milwaukee_Bucks "Milwaukee Bucks") in the draft.[7] [Stephen
Curry](/wiki/Stephen_Curry "Stephen Curry") was named NBA MVP for 2
consecutive years (2015–2016), and won his first NBA championship in 2015.

Of the 60 players drafted, four were freshmen, nine were
[sophomores](/wiki/Sophomore_year "Sophomore year"), 12 were
[juniors](/wiki/Junior_\(education\) "Junior \(education\)"), 22 were
[seniors](/wiki/Senior_\(education\) "Senior \(education\)"), and 13 were
international players without U.S. college basketball experience. The
[University of North
Carolina](/wiki/University_of_North_Carolina_at_Chapel_Hill "University of
North Carolina at Chapel Hill")'s [Tar
Heels](/wiki/North_Carolina_Tar_Heels_men%27s_basketball "North Carolina Tar
Heels men's basketball") had the most players selected in the draft; three
players were selected in the first round and one was selected in the second
round. This marked the second time ever that four Tar Heels players were
selected in the first two rounds of an NBA draft.[8] The Minnesota
Timberwolves had the league-high four first-round draft picks and the first
time in team history that the team held two top-10 draft picks.[9] The
Timberwolves also had two second-round draft picks and became the team with
the most draft picks in the 2009 draft with a total of six. The [Houston
Rockets](/wiki/Houston_Rockets "Houston Rockets") and the [Orlando
Magic](/wiki/Orlando_Magic "Orlando Magic") were the only NBA teams who did
not have a draft pick this year, although Houston acquired three drafted
players' rights after the draft.[10]

## Eligibility[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2009_NBA_draft&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Eligibility")]

Further information: [Eligibility for the NBA
draft](/wiki/Eligibility_for_the_NBA_draft "Eligibility for the NBA draft")

The basic requirements for draft eligibility are:[35]

  * All drafted players must be born on or before December 31, 1990.
  * Any player who is not an "international player", as defined in the collective bargaining agreement (CBA) between the NBA and its players union, must be at least one year removed from the graduation of his high school class.

The CBA defines "international players" as players who permanently resided
outside the U.S. for three years prior to the draft, did not complete high
school in the U.S., and have never enrolled at a U.S. college or
university.[36]

The basic requirement for automatic eligibility for a U.S. player is the
completion of his college eligibility.[37] Players who meet the CBA definition
of "international players" are automatically eligible if their 22nd birthday
falls during or before the calendar year of the draft (i.e., born on or before
December 31, 1987).[38] U.S. players who were at least one year removed from
their high school graduation and have played professional basketball with a
team outside the NBA were also automatically eligible. Former high school
player [Brandon Jennings](/wiki/Brandon_Jennings "Brandon Jennings") meets
these criteria, having graduated high school in 2008, skipped [college
basketball](/wiki/College_basketball "College basketball") and then played
professional basketball in [Italy](/wiki/Lega_Basket_Serie_A "Lega Basket
Serie A").[7]

A player who is not automatically eligible must declare his eligibility for
the draft by notifying the NBA offices in writing no later than 60 days before
the draft.[39][40] For the 2009 draft, this date fell on April 26. An early
entry candidate is allowed to withdraw his eligibility for the draft by
notifying the NBA offices in writing no later than 10 days before the
draft.[41] This year, a total of 74 collegiate players and 29 international
players declared as early entry candidates.[42] At the withdrawal deadline, 55
early-entry candidates withdrew from the draft, leaving 39 collegiate players
and 10 international players as the early-entry candidates for the draft.[11]

A player who has hired an [agent](/wiki/Sports_agent "Sports agent") will
forfeit his remaining college eligibility, regardless of whether he is
drafted. Also, while the collective bargaining agreement (CBA) between the
league and its players' union allows a player to withdraw from the draft
twice,[41] the [National Collegiate Athletic
Association](/wiki/National_Collegiate_Athletic_Association "National
Collegiate Athletic Association") (NCAA) mandates that a player who has
declared twice loses his college eligibility. This second provision affected
[Chase Budinger](/wiki/Chase_Budinger "Chase Budinger"), [Wayne
Ellington](/wiki/Wayne_Ellington "Wayne Ellington"), and [Ty
Lawson](/wiki/Ty_Lawson "Ty Lawson"), all of whom declared for and withdrew
from the 2008 draft.[43]

## Draft
lottery[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2009_NBA_draft&action=edit&section=4 "Edit
section: Draft lottery")]

Further information: [NBA draft lottery](/wiki/NBA_draft_lottery "NBA draft
lottery")

The lottery selection to determine the order of the top fourteen picks in the
2009 draft occurred on May 19, 2009.[44] The [Los Angeles
Clippers](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Clippers "Los Angeles Clippers") won the first
pick, while the [Memphis Grizzlies](/wiki/Memphis_Grizzlies "Memphis
Grizzlies") and [Oklahoma City Thunder](/wiki/Oklahoma_City_Thunder "Oklahoma
City Thunder") moved up to second and third picks respectively. The
[Sacramento Kings](/wiki/Sacramento_Kings "Sacramento Kings") and [Washington
Wizards](/wiki/Washington_Wizards "Washington Wizards"), who had the two best
chances to land a top-three pick, fell down to the fourth and fifth spots, the
lowest possible picks they could be awarded through the lottery.[1] The
remaining first-round picks and all the second-round picks were assigned to
teams in reverse order of their win-loss records in the [previous
season](/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_NBA_season "2008–09 NBA season"). As is
commonplace in the event of identical win-loss records, the NBA performed a
random drawing to break the ties on April 17, 2009.[45]

## Trades involving draft
picks[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2009_NBA_draft&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: Trades involving draft picks")]

### Pre-draft
trades[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2009_NBA_draft&action=edit&section=6 "Edit
section: Pre-draft trades")]

Prior to the day of the draft, the following trades were made and resulted in
exchanges of draft picks between the teams.

  * **a 1** **2** On June 24, 2009, [Minnesota](/wiki/Minnesota_Timberwolves "Minnesota Timberwolves") acquired the 5th pick, [Etan Thomas](/wiki/Etan_Thomas "Etan Thomas"), [Darius Songaila](/wiki/Darius_Songaila "Darius Songaila") and [Oleksiy Pecherov](/wiki/Oleksiy_Pecherov "Oleksiy Pecherov") from [Washington](/wiki/Washington_Wizards "Washington Wizards") in exchange for [Randy Foye](/wiki/Randy_Foye "Randy Foye") and [Mike Miller](/wiki/Mike_Miller_\(basketball_player\) "Mike Miller \(basketball player\)").[9] Minnesota used the 5th pick to draft [Ricky Rubio](/wiki/Ricky_Rubio "Ricky Rubio").
  * **b** On July 31, 2007, Minnesota re-acquired their 2009 first-round draft pick along with [Al Jefferson](/wiki/Al_Jefferson "Al Jefferson"), [Gerald Green](/wiki/Gerald_Green "Gerald Green"), [Ryan Gomes](/wiki/Ryan_Gomes "Ryan Gomes"), [Sebastian Telfair](/wiki/Sebastian_Telfair "Sebastian Telfair"), [Theo Ratliff](/wiki/Theo_Ratliff "Theo Ratliff"), a 2009 first-round draft pick and cash considerations from [Boston](/wiki/Boston_Celtics "Boston Celtics") in exchange for [Kevin Garnett](/wiki/Kevin_Garnett "Kevin Garnett").[47] Previously, Boston acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Wally Szczerbiak](/wiki/Wally_Szczerbiak "Wally Szczerbiak"), [Michael Olowokandi](/wiki/Michael_Olowokandi "Michael Olowokandi") and [Dwayne Jones](/wiki/Dwayne_Jones_\(basketball\) "Dwayne Jones \(basketball\)") on January 26, 2006 from Minnesota in exchange for [Ricky Davis](/wiki/Ricky_Davis "Ricky Davis"), [Marcus Banks](/wiki/Marcus_Banks "Marcus Banks"), [Mark Blount](/wiki/Mark_Blount "Mark Blount"), [Justin Reed](/wiki/Justin_Reed "Justin Reed") and two second-round draft picks.[47][48] Minnesota used the 28th pick to draft [Wayne Ellington](/wiki/Wayne_Ellington "Wayne Ellington").
  * **c** On October 24, 2007, Minnesota acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Antoine Walker](/wiki/Antoine_Walker "Antoine Walker"), [Wayne Simien](/wiki/Wayne_Simien "Wayne Simien"), [Michael Doleac](/wiki/Michael_Doleac "Michael Doleac") and cash considerations from [Miami](/wiki/Miami_Heat "Miami Heat") in exchange for Ricky Davis and Mark Blount.[49] Minnesota used the 18th pick to draft [Ty Lawson](/wiki/Ty_Lawson "Ty Lawson").
  * **d 1** **2** **3** On June 24, 2009, [Portland](/wiki/Portland_Trail_Blazers "Portland Trail Blazers") acquired the 22nd pick from [Dallas](/wiki/Dallas_Mavericks "Dallas Mavericks") in exchange for the 24th pick, 56th pick and a 2010 second-round draft pick.[50] Portland used the 22nd pick to draft [Víctor Claver](/wiki/V%C3%ADctor_Claver "Víctor Claver") and Dallas used the 24th and 56th pick to draft [Byron Mullens](/wiki/Byron_Mullens "Byron Mullens") and [Ahmad Nivins](/wiki/Ahmad_Nivins "Ahmad Nivins"), respectively.
  * **e** On August 14, 2008, [Sacramento](/wiki/Sacramento_Kings "Sacramento Kings") acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Bobby Jackson](/wiki/Bobby_Jackson_\(basketball\) "Bobby Jackson \(basketball\)"), [Donté Greene](/wiki/Dont%C3%A9_Greene "Donté Greene") and cash considerations from [Houston](/wiki/Houston_Rockets "Houston Rockets") in exchange for [Ron Artest](/wiki/Ron_Artest "Ron Artest"), [Sean Singletary](/wiki/Sean_Singletary "Sean Singletary") and [Patrick Ewing Jr.](/wiki/Patrick_Ewing_Jr. "Patrick Ewing Jr.").[51] Sacramento used the 23rd pick to draft [Omri Casspi](/wiki/Omri_Casspi "Omri Casspi").
  * **f** On February 20, 2008, [Oklahoma City](/wiki/Oklahoma_City_Thunder "Oklahoma City Thunder") (as [Seattle](/wiki/Seattle_SuperSonics "Seattle SuperSonics")) acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Francisco Elson](/wiki/Francisco_Elson "Francisco Elson") and [Brent Barry](/wiki/Brent_Barry "Brent Barry") from [San Antonio](/wiki/San_Antonio_Spurs "San Antonio Spurs") in exchange for [Kurt Thomas](/wiki/Kurt_Thomas_\(basketball\) "Kurt Thomas \(basketball\)").[52] Oklahoma City used the 25th pick to draft [Rodrigue Beaubois](/wiki/Rodrigue_Beaubois "Rodrigue Beaubois").
  * **g** On February 19, 2009, [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago_Bulls "Chicago Bulls") acquired [Denver](/wiki/Denver_Nuggets "Denver Nuggets")'s 2009 first-round draft pick from Oklahoma City in exchange for [Thabo Sefolosha](/wiki/Thabo_Sefolosha "Thabo Sefolosha").[53] Previously, Oklahoma City acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Chucky Atkins](/wiki/Chucky_Atkins "Chucky Atkins") and cash considerations on January 7, 2009 from Denver in exchange for a 2009 second-round draft pick and [Johan Petro](/wiki/Johan_Petro "Johan Petro").[54] Chicago used the 26th pick to draft [Taj Gibson](/wiki/Taj_Gibson "Taj Gibson").
  * **h** On February 19, 2009, [Memphis](/wiki/Memphis_Grizzlies "Memphis Grizzlies") acquired a 2009 first-round draft pick, [Mike Wilks](/wiki/Mike_Wilks_\(basketball\) "Mike Wilks \(basketball\)"), [Adonal Foyle](/wiki/Adonal_Foyle "Adonal Foyle") and cash considerations from [Orlando](/wiki/Orlando_Magic "Orlando Magic") in a three-team trade with Orlando and Houston.[55] Memphis used the 27th pick to draft [DeMarre Carroll](/wiki/DeMarre_Carroll "DeMarre Carroll").
  * **j** On June 26, 2008, Portland acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick from the [L.A. Clippers](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Clippers "Los Angeles Clippers") in exchange for the draft rights to [Mike Taylor](/wiki/Mike_Taylor_\(basketball\) "Mike Taylor \(basketball\)").[56] Portland used the 33rd pick to draft [Dante Cunningham](/wiki/Dante_Cunningham "Dante Cunningham").
  * **k** On January 7, 2009, Denver acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick and Johan Petro from Oklahoma City in exchange for a 2009 first-round draft pick, Chucky Atkins and cash considerations.[54] Denver used the 34th pick to draft [Sergio Llull](/wiki/Sergio_Llull "Sergio Llull").
  * **l** On October 31, 2005, [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit_Pistons "Detroit Pistons") acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick from Minnesota in exchange for [Ronald Dupree](/wiki/Ronald_Dupree "Ronald Dupree").[57] Detroit used the 35th pick to draft [DaJuan Summers](/wiki/DaJuan_Summers "DaJuan Summers").
  * **m** On December 24, 2008, Memphis re-acquired their 2009 second-round draft pick along with [Steve Francis](/wiki/Steve_Francis "Steve Francis") and cash considerations from Houston in exchange for a 2011 second-round draft pick.[58] Previously, Houston acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick and the draft rights to Donté Greene from Memphis in a three-team trade with Memphis and Portland on June 26, 2008.[59]
  * **n** On June 26, 2008, San Antonio acquired [Golden State](/wiki/Golden_State_Warriors "Golden State Warriors")'s 2009 second-round draft pick, the draft rights to [Malik Hairston](/wiki/Malik_Hairston "Malik Hairston") and cash considerations from [Phoenix](/wiki/Phoenix_Suns "Phoenix Suns") in exchange for the draft rights to [Goran Dragić](/wiki/Goran_Dragi%C4%87 "Goran Dragić").[60] Previously, Phoenix acquired 2007 and 2009 second-round draft picks on January 3, 2005 from Golden State in exchange for [Žarko Čabarkapa](/wiki/%C5%BDarko_%C4%8Cabarkapa "Žarko Čabarkapa").[61] San Antonio used the 37th pick to draft [DeJuan Blair](/wiki/DeJuan_Blair "DeJuan Blair").
  * **o 1** **2** On June 26, 2008, Portland acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick from Denver in a three-team trade with Denver and Chicago. Portland also acquired [New York](/wiki/New_York_Knicks "New York Knicks")'s 2009 second-round draft pick and Chicago's 2010 second-round draft pick from Chicago.[56] Previously, Chicago acquired a 2006 first-round draft pick, 2007 and 2009 second-round draft picks, an option to exchange 2007 first-round draft picks, [Tim Thomas](/wiki/Tim_Thomas_\(basketball\) "Tim Thomas \(basketball\)"), [Michael Sweetney](/wiki/Michael_Sweetney "Michael Sweetney") and [Jermaine Jackson](/wiki/Jermaine_Jackson_\(basketball\) "Jermaine Jackson \(basketball\)") on October 4, 2005 from New York in exchange for [Eddy Curry](/wiki/Eddy_Curry "Eddy Curry") and [Antonio Davis](/wiki/Antonio_Davis "Antonio Davis").[62] Portland used the 38th and 55th pick to draft [Jon Brockman](/wiki/Jon_Brockman "Jon Brockman") and [Patrick Mills](/wiki/Patrick_Mills "Patrick Mills"), respectively.
  * **p** On June 15, 2007, Detroit acquired 2009 and 2011 second-round draft picks from [Toronto](/wiki/Toronto_Raptors "Toronto Raptors") in exchange for [Carlos Delfino](/wiki/Carlos_Delfino "Carlos Delfino").[63] Detroit used the 39th pick to draft [Jonas Jerebko](/wiki/Jonas_Jerebko "Jonas Jerebko").
  * **q** On August 11, 2008, [Charlotte](/wiki/Charlotte_Hornets "Charlotte Hornets") acquired [New Jersey](/wiki/New_Jersey_Nets "New Jersey Nets")'s 2009 second-round draft pick from Oklahoma City in exchange for the draft rights to [Kyle Weaver](/wiki/Kyle_Weaver "Kyle Weaver").[64] Previously, Oklahoma City (as Seattle) acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick on July 7, 2006 from New Jersey in exchange for [Mikki Moore](/wiki/Mikki_Moore "Mikki Moore").[65] Charlotte used the 40th pick to draft [Derrick Brown](/wiki/Derrick_Brown_\(basketball,_born_1987\) "Derrick Brown \(basketball, born 1987\)").
  * **r** On December 6, 2004, the [L.A. Lakers](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Lakers "Los Angeles Lakers") acquired 2005 and 2009 second-round draft picks from Charlotte in exchange for [Kareem Rush](/wiki/Kareem_Rush "Kareem Rush").[66] The L.A. Lakers used the 42nd pick to draft [Patrick Beverley](/wiki/Patrick_Beverley "Patrick Beverley").
  * **s** On June 28, 2007, Miami acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick from [Indiana](/wiki/Indiana_Pacers "Indiana Pacers") in exchange for the draft rights to [Stanko Barać](/wiki/Stanko_Bara%C4%87 "Stanko Barać").[67] Miami used the 43rd pick to draft [Marcus Thornton](/wiki/Marcus_Thornton_\(basketball,_born_1987\) "Marcus Thornton \(basketball, born 1987\)").
  * **t 1** **2** On June 26, 2008, Minnesota acquired [Philadelphia](/wiki/Philadelphia_76ers "Philadelphia 76ers")'s and Miami's 2009 second-round draft picks and cash considerations from Miami in exchange for the draft rights to [Mario Chalmers](/wiki/Mario_Chalmers "Mario Chalmers").[68] Previously, Miami acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick, the draft rights to [Daequan Cook](/wiki/Daequan_Cook "Daequan Cook") and cash considerations on June 28, 2007 from Philadelphia in exchange for the draft rights to [Jason Smith](/wiki/Jason_Smith_\(American_basketball\) "Jason Smith \(American basketball\)").[69] Minnesota used the 45th and 47th pick to draft [Nick Calathes](/wiki/Nick_Calathes "Nick Calathes") and [Henk Norel](/wiki/Henk_Norel "Henk Norel"), respectively.
  * **u** On February 21, 2008, [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland_Cavaliers "Cleveland Cavaliers") acquired [Ben Wallace](/wiki/Ben_Wallace "Ben Wallace"), [Joe Smith](/wiki/Joe_Smith_\(basketball\) "Joe Smith \(basketball\)") and a 2009 second-round draft pick from Chicago in a three-team trade with Chicago and Oklahoma City (as Seattle).[70] Cleveland used the 46th pick to draft [Danny Green](/wiki/Danny_Green_\(basketball\) "Danny Green \(basketball\)").
  * **v** On June 21, 2006, San Antonio acquired [New Orleans](/wiki/New_Orleans_Pelicans "New Orleans Pelicans")'s 2009 second-round draft pick, [Matt Bonner](/wiki/Matt_Bonner "Matt Bonner") and [Eric Williams](/wiki/Eric_Williams_\(basketball,_born_1972\) "Eric Williams \(basketball, born 1972\)") from Toronto in exchange for [Rasho Nesterović](/wiki/Radoslav_Nesterovi%C4%87 "Radoslav Nesterović").[71] Previously, Toronto acquired Miami's 2006 second-round draft pick and New Orleans's 2009 second-round draft pick on January 31, 2006 from New Orleans in exchange for [Aaron Williams](/wiki/Aaron_Williams_\(basketball\) "Aaron Williams \(basketball\)").[72] San Antonio used the 51st pick to draft [Jack McClinton](/wiki/Jack_McClinton "Jack McClinton").
  * **w** On October 10, 2008, Indiana acquired 2009 and 2010 second-round draft picks, [Eddie Jones](/wiki/Eddie_Jones_\(basketball\) "Eddie Jones \(basketball\)") and cash considerations from Dallas in exchange for [Shawne Williams](/wiki/Shawne_Williams "Shawne Williams").[73] Indiana used the 52nd pick to draft [A. J. Price](/wiki/A._J._Price "A. J. Price").
  * **x** On July 12, 2007, San Antonio acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick, [Vassilis Spanoulis](/wiki/Vassilis_Spanoulis "Vassilis Spanoulis") and cash considerations from Houston in exchange for [Jackie Butler](/wiki/Jackie_Butler "Jackie Butler") and the draft rights to [Luis Scola](/wiki/Luis_Scola "Luis Scola").[74] San Antonio used the 53rd pick to draft [Nando de Colo](/wiki/Nando_de_Colo "Nando de Colo").
  * **y** On February 13, 2007, Charlotte acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick, Eric Williams and cash considerations from San Antonio in exchange for [Melvin Ely](/wiki/Melvin_Ely "Melvin Ely").[75] Charlotte used the 54th pick to draft [Robert Vaden](/wiki/Robert_Vaden "Robert Vaden").
  * **z** On July 20, 2007, Phoenix acquired Orlando's 2009 second-round draft pick from Oklahoma City (as Seattle) in exchange for 2008 and 2010 first-round draft picks and Kurt Thomas.[76] Previously, Oklahoma City (as Seattle) acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick on July 11, 2007 from Orlando in exchange for [Rashard Lewis](/wiki/Rashard_Lewis "Rashard Lewis").[77] Phoenix used the 57th pick to draft [Emir Preldžič](/wiki/Emir_Preld%C5%BEi%C4%8D "Emir Preldžič").
  * **aa** On June 26, 2008, Miami acquired a 2009 second-round draft pick from Cleveland in exchange for the draft rights to [Darnell Jackson](/wiki/Darnell_Jackson "Darnell Jackson").[78] Miami used the 60th pick to draft [Robert Dozier](/wiki/Robert_Dozier "Robert Dozier").

### Draft-day
trades[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2009_NBA_draft&action=edit&section=7 "Edit
section: Draft-day trades")]

The following trades involving drafted players were made on the day of the
draft.

  * **A** [Denver](/wiki/Denver_Nuggets "Denver Nuggets") acquired the draft rights to 18th pick [Ty Lawson](/wiki/Ty_Lawson "Ty Lawson") from [Minnesota](/wiki/Minnesota_Timberwolves "Minnesota Timberwolves") in exchange for a future conditional first-round draft pick.[79]

  * **B 1** **2** [Oklahoma City](/wiki/Oklahoma_City_Thunder "Oklahoma City Thunder") acquired the draft rights to 24th pick [Byron Mullens](/wiki/Byron_Mullens "Byron Mullens") from [Dallas](/wiki/Dallas_Mavericks "Dallas Mavericks") in exchange for the draft rights to 25th pick [Rodrigue Beaubois](/wiki/Rodrigue_Beaubois "Rodrigue Beaubois") and a 2010 second-round draft pick.[80]
  * **C** [New York](/wiki/New_York_Knicks "New York Knicks") acquired the draft rights to 29th pick [Toney Douglas](/wiki/Toney_Douglas "Toney Douglas") from the [L.A. Lakers](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Lakers "Los Angeles Lakers") in exchange for a 2011 second-round draft pick and cash considerations.[81]
  * **D 1** **2** [Portland](/wiki/Portland_Trail_Blazers "Portland Trail Blazers") acquired the draft rights to 31st pick [Jeff Pendergraph](/wiki/Jeff_Ayres "Jeff Ayres") from [Sacramento](/wiki/Sacramento_Kings "Sacramento Kings") in exchange for [Sergio Rodríguez](/wiki/Sergio_Rodr%C3%ADguez "Sergio Rodríguez"), the draft rights to 38th pick [Jon Brockman](/wiki/Jon_Brockman "Jon Brockman") and cash considerations.[82]
  * **E** [Houston](/wiki/Houston_Rockets "Houston Rockets") acquired the draft rights to 32nd pick [Jermaine Taylor](/wiki/Jermaine_Taylor_\(basketball\) "Jermaine Taylor \(basketball\)") from [Washington](/wiki/Washington_Wizards "Washington Wizards") in exchange for cash considerations.[83]
  * **F** Houston acquired the draft rights to 34th pick [Sergio Llull](/wiki/Sergio_Llull "Sergio Llull") from [Denver](/wiki/Denver_Nuggets "Denver Nuggets") in exchange for cash considerations.[84]
  * **G** [Miami](/wiki/Miami_Heat "Miami Heat") acquired the draft rights to 42nd pick [Patrick Beverley](/wiki/Patrick_Beverley "Patrick Beverley") from the L.A. Lakers in exchange for a 2011 second-round draft pick and cash considerations.[85]
  * **H** [New Orleans](/wiki/New_Orleans_Pelicans "New Orleans Pelicans") acquired the draft rights to 43rd pick [Marcus Thornton](/wiki/Marcus_Thornton_\(basketball,_born_1987\) "Marcus Thornton \(basketball, born 1987\)") from Miami in exchange for 2010 and 2012 second-round draft picks.[86]
  * **I** Houston acquired the draft rights to 44th pick [Chase Budinger](/wiki/Chase_Budinger "Chase Budinger") from [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit_Pistons "Detroit Pistons") in exchange for a future second-round draft pick and cash considerations.[87]
  * **J** Dallas acquired the draft rights to 45th pick [Nick Calathes](/wiki/Nick_Calathes "Nick Calathes") from Minnesota in exchange for a 2010 second-round draft pick and cash considerations.[88]
  * **K** Oklahoma City acquired the draft rights to 54th pick [Robert Vaden](/wiki/Robert_Vaden "Robert Vaden") from [Charlotte](/wiki/Charlotte_Bobcats "Charlotte Bobcats") in exchange for cash considerations.[80]
  * **L** [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland_Cavaliers "Cleveland Cavaliers") acquired the draft rights to 57th pick [Emir Preldžič](/wiki/Emir_Preld%C5%BEi%C4%8D "Emir Preldžič") from [Phoenix](/wiki/Phoenix_Suns "Phoenix Suns") in exchange for cash considerations.[89]
